greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into distinct divisors of n.
link: T. D. Noe and Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (1000 terms from T. D. Noe)
formula: a(n) = f(n, n, 1) with f(n, m, k) = if k <= m then f(n, m, k + 1) + f(n, m - k, k + 1)*0^(n mod k) else 0^m. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 11 2009
a(n) = 1 if n is deficient (A005100) or weird (A006037). a(n) = 2 if n is perfect (A000396). - _Alonso del Arte_, Sep 24 2017
example: a(12) = 3 because we have the partitions [12], [6, 4, 2], and [6, 3, 2, 1].
maple: with(numtheory): a:=proc(n) local div, g, gser: div:=divisors(n): g:=product(1+x^div[j],j=1..tau(n)): gser:=series(g,x=0,105): coeff(gser,x^n): end: seq(a(n),n=1..100); # _Emeric Deutsch_, Mar 30 2006
a:= proc(n) local b, l; l:= sort([(divisors(n))[]]):
mathematica: A033630 = Table[SeriesCoefficient[Series[Times@@((1 + z^#) & /@ Divisors[n]), {z, 0, n}], n ], {n, 512}] (* _Wouter Meeussen_ *)

A033630[n_] := f[n, n, 1]; f[n_, m_, k_] := f[n, m, k] = If[k <= m, f[n, m, k + 1] + f[n, m - k, k + 1] * Boole[Mod[n, k] == 0], Boole[m == 0]]; Array[A033630, 101, 0] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 29 2015, after _Reinhard Zumkeller_ *)
program: a033630 n = p (a027750_row n) n where
p (d:ds) m = if d > m then 0 else p ds (m - d) + p ds m
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_
